Options.Name: Silhouette
Options.Description: Aleena are smaller than average and count as silhouette 0.

Options.Name: Mood Indicator
Options.Description: If an Anx's head-crest is not covered, the character upgrades the difficulty of Deception checks once.

SubSpeciesList.Name: Aquala
SubSpeciesList.Description: Please see page 20 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

Options.Name: Environmental Conditions
Options.Description: Aquala may remove [SETBACK] imposed due to any cold or wet conditions.

SubSpeciesList.Name: Ualaq
SubSpeciesList.Description: Please see page 20 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

Options.Name: Survival
Options.Description: Ualaq may begin the game with one rank in Survival.

Options.Name: Perception
Options.Description: Ualaq may begin the game with one rank in Perception.

Options.Name: Environmental Conditions
Options.Description: Ualaq may remove [SETBACK] imposed due to dark conditions, but suffer [SETBACK] to  Perception checks in brightly lit environments

SubSpeciesList.Name: Quara
SubSpeciesList.Description: Please see page 20 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

Options.Name: Athletics
Options.Description: Quara may begin the game with one rank in Athletics.

Options.Name: Coercion
Options.Description: Quara may begin the game with one rank in Coercion.

Options.Name: Environmental Conditions
Options.Description: Quara may remove [SETBACK] when attempting to track anything through a natural environment.

Options.Name: Underwater Breathing
Options.Description: All Aqualish are capable of breathing underwater.

Options.Name: Environment
Options.Description: Arcona may remove [SETBACK] imposed due to arid or hot environmental conditions.

Options.Name: Mood Readers
Options.Description: Arcona add [ADVANTAGE] to any Charm or Negotiation checks they make.

Options.Name: Dark Vision
Options.Description: Arkanians remove up to [SE][SE] due to darkness when making skill checks.

Options.Name: Antennapalps
Options.Description: Balosars add automatic [AD][AD] to all Vigilance checks.

Options.Name: Additional Limbs
Options.Description: Besalisks have four arms and gain an additional free maneuver per turn. They still may not perform more than two maneuvers per turn, however.

Options.Name: Sensitive Hearing
Options.Description: Bith add [BO] whenever they make a hearing-based Perception check.

Options.Name: Sensitive Hearing
Options.Description: When Bith suffer strain due to loud noises, they suffer twice the normal amount of strain.

Source.__text: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Options.Name: One Rank in Charm
Options.Description: Caamasi may begin the game with one rank in Charm.

Options.Name: One Rank in Discipline
Options.Description: Caamasi may begin the game with one rank in Discipline.

Options.Name: Memnii
Options.Description: Once per game session, a Caamasi may form a new memnis that encompasses one scene or encounter. At any time, a Caamasi may perfectly recall any memnis that he has formed or witnessed, or share it with another Caamasi or Force-sensitive.

Options.Name: Acute Senses
Options.Description: Chandra-Fan remove up to [REMSETBACK][REMSETBACK] from Perception checks due to superior senses.

Options.Name: Reduced Silouette
Options.Description: Chadra-Fan have a Silhouette of 0.

Options.Name: Amphibious
Options.Description: Chagrians can breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

Options.Name: Advanced Olfaction
Options.Description: Chevin add [BOOST] to Perception checks involving the sense of smell.

Options.Name: Infravision
Options.Description: Chiss have adapted to be able to see in both the infrared and normal visual spectra. This enables Chiss characters to remove up to [SETBACK] added to checks by lighting conditions.

Options.Name: Changeling
Options.Description: As an action, may suffer 3 strain and make an Average ([DI][DI]) Resilience check to change appearance to match a previously-observed silhouette 1 character. Observer must make an opposed Perception vs. Deception check to detect that something is amiss.

Options.Name: Piloting - Planetary
Options.Description: May begin game with one rank in Piloting - Planetary.

Options.Name: Piloting - Space
Options.Description: May begin game with one rank in Piloting - Space.

Options.Name: Strong Backed
Options.Description: Cosians gain +5 to their encumbrance threshold.

Options.Name: One Rank in Deception
Options.Description: Devaronian may begin the game with one rank in Deception.

Options.Name: One Rank in Survival
Options.Description: Devaronian may begin the game with one rank in Survival.

Options.Name: Resillient Metabolism
Options.Description: Devaronians add automatic [SU] to all Resillience checks.

Options.Name: Average-Sized
Options.Description: Silhouette 1

Options.Name: Large-Sized
Options.Description: Silhouette 2

Options.Name: Immovable
Options.Description: Dowutins who are immobilized, knocked prone, or otherwise moved against their will, may suffer 3 strain to avoid the affect. Dowutins who are silhouette 2 only suffer 1 strain to use this ability.

Options.Name: Charm
Options.Description: Drabatan may start the game with one rank in Charm.

Options.Name: Leadership
Options.Description: Drabatan may start the game with one rank in Leadership.

Options.Name: Big Noise
Options.Description: When making a Leadership or Coercion check, Drabatans can spend [AD][AD] to affect one additional character not originally targeted by the check or affect targets at one range band further than normal.

Options.Name: Skilled Assistance
Options.Description: Drall add [BOOST] when providing skilled assistance.

Options.Name: Primitive
Options.Description: Dressellians must upgrade the difficulty of any checks involving non-Dressellian technology.

Options.Name: Non-Primitive
Options.Description: Tech-saavy Dressellians do not need to upgrade the difficulty of checks involving non-Dressellian technology. -10 Starting XP

Options.Name: Additional Career Skills
Options.Description: May train in two additional career skills and one additional specialization skills

Options.Name: Feature
Options.Description: Droids do not need to eat, sleep, or breath, and are unaffected by vacuum, toxins, and poisons.

Options.Name: Inorganic
Options.Description: Droids do not gain benefits from bacta, stimpacks, or Medicine checks. They must be repaired with repair patches and Mechanics checks.

Options.Name: Mechanical Being
Options.Description: Droids cannot become Force sensitive, cannot acquire a Force Rating or Force powers, and are not affected by mind-altering Force powers.

Options.Name: Cybernetics
Options.Description: Droids have a cybernetics implant cap of 6.

Source.__text: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Options.Name: Intuitive Navigation
Options.Description: Add [ADVANTAGE] to all Astrogation checks.

OptionChoices.Name: Digging Claws
OptionChoices.Description: Elom may use a move maneuver to travel through loose soil or similar terrain. Can result in low, narrow tunnel that others can use, at GM's discretion.

Options.Name: Stealth
Options.Description: Ewoks may begin with a rank in Stealth. They still may not raise the skill above rank 2 during character creation.

Options.Name: Survival
Options.Description: Ewoks may begin with a rank in Survival. They still may not raise the skill above rank 2 during character creation.

Options.Name: Size
Options.Description: Ewoks are usually smaller than average and count as silhouette 0. Acute Senses: Ewoks add [BO] to Perception and Vigilance checks.

Options.Name: Low-Tech
Options.Description: Ewoks upgrade the difficulty of any checks involving advanced technology not available on their home planet once. If an Ewok uses a particular piece of advanced technology for an extended period of time, they may become familiar with it and be exempt from this rule when using that piece of technology (at the GM's discretion).

Options.Name: Adapted
Options.Description: With GM approval, a player with an Ewok character may spend 10 XP to remove this disadvantage from their character.

Options.Name: Beguiling Pheromones
Options.Description: Once per check as an incidental, may suffer 2 strain to upgrade ability of Charm, Deception, or Negotiation check against living, sentient being within short range. No effect if wearing breath mask or having no respiratory system.

Options.Name: Has Lungs
Options.Description: Starts the game with an ammonia respirator, and treats oxygen as a dangerous atmosphere with Rating 8. Gains +10 starting XP

Options.Name: Lungless
Options.Description: Immune to suffocation (but not the wounds suffered from being exposed to vacuum).

Source.__text: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Options.Name: Coercion
Options.Description: Ganks may begin the game with one rank in Coercion.

Options.Name: Vigilance
Options.Description: Ganks may begin the game with one rank in Vigilance.

Options.Name: Cyborg
Options.Description: Ganks may begin play with up to two cybernetic implants that cost up to 5,000 credits. Extra credits for obligation may be applied to purchase these cybernetics.

Options.Name: Skill Choice
Options.Description: Geonisians start the game with one rank in any skill of their choice.

Options.Name: Industrious
Options.Description: A Geonosian who provides assistance adds [BO] to the check, in addition to the normal benefits of assistance, and the Geonosian heals 1 strain.

Options.Name: Winged
Options.Description: Geonosians can fly.

Options.Name: Adapted to the Cold
Options.Description: Gigorans remove [SE] imposed due to cold or snow-filled conditions.

Options.Name: Low-Tech
Options.Description: Gigorans upgrade the difficulty of Mechanics checks involving advanced technology once.

Options.Name: Small
Options.Description: Gossam are smaller than average and count as silhouette 0.

Options.Name: Energy Sensitivity
Options.Description: Once per encounter as a maneuver, may sense the presence and current emotional states of all living things within short range.

Options.Name: One rank in Charm
Options.Description: Gran may take one rank in Charm

Options.Name: One rank in Negotiation
Options.Description: Gran may take one rank in Negotiation

Options.Name: Enhanced Vision
Options.Description: When making ranged combat or Perception checks, Gran remove up to [SETBACK][SETBACK] imposed due to environmental conditions or concealment (but not defense).

Options.Name: Amphibious
Options.Description: Gungans may breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

Options.Name: Additional Non-Career Skills
Options.Description: Humans start the game with one rank in two different non-career skills of their choice.

Source.__text: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Options.Name: Coercion
Options.Description: Hutts may begin the game with one rank in Coercion.

Options.Name: Discipline
Options.Description: Hutts may begin the game with one rank in Discipline.

Options.Name: Ponderous
Options.Description: A Hutt can never spend more than one maneuver moving per turn.

Options.Name: Brachiation
Options.Description: Iakaru suffer no terrian penalties to movement though jungles or similar environments. They also add [BO] to Athletics and Coordination checks related to climbing, swinging, and balancing.

Options.Name: Precognition
Options.Description: In addition to seeing flashes of the future at the GM's discretion, an Iktotchi may spend [TR] on an Initiative check to perform a free maneuver, or have an ally within short range perform a free maneuver, before the encounter begins.

Options.Name: Amphibious
Options.Description: Ishi Tib can breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

Options.Name: Water Dependence
Options.Description: If an Ishi Tib has not been doused in salt water in the last twenty-four hours, the character's wound threshold is reduced by 2. This condition remains in effect until the ishi Tib is doused in salt water.

Options.Name: Bellow
Options.Description: With two mouths and four throats, Ithorians have a unique natural weapon they can call upon when threatened. Each time the Ithorian uses this ability, he suffers 3 strain..

Options.Name: Negotiation
Options.Description: Jawas may begin with one rank in Negotiation. They still may not train the skill above rank 2 during character creation.

Options.Name: Skulduggery
Options.Description: Jawas may begin with one rank in Skulduggery. They still may not train the skill above rank 2 during character creation.

Options.Name: Size
Options.Description: Jawas count as silhouette 0

Options.Name: Expressionless
Options.Description: Kaminoans add [SE] to all Charm checks they make.

Options.Name: Expressionless
Options.Description: Other characters add [SE] to all social skill checks made against Kaminoans.

Options.Name: May use jaws when brawling
Options.Description: When a Karkarodon makes Brawl checks to deal damage to an opponent, they deal +1 damage and have a Critical Rating of 3.

Options.Name: Amphibious
Options.Description: Karkarodons are Amphibious and can breathe and move in water without penalty.

Options.Name: Dark Vision
Options.Description: Kel Dors remove up to [SETBACK][SETBACK] imposed due to darkness from any skill checks.

Options.Name: Atmospheric Requirement
Options.Description: Kel Dors must wear a specialized mask to breath and see outside of their native atmosphere. However, Kel Dor may survive in vacuum for up to five minues before suffering its effects.

Options.Name: Additional Non-Career Skill
Options.Description: Klatooninians start the game with one additional rank of one non-career skill of his choice.

Options.Name: One Rank in Brawl
Options.Description: Klatooninians may begin the game with one rank in Brawl.

Options.Name: One Rank in Ranged-Heavy
Options.Description: Klatooninians may begin the game with one rank in Ranged-Heavy.

Options.Name: One Rank in Ranged-Light
Options.Description: Klatooninians may begin the game with one rank in Ranged-Light.

Options.Name: Stealth
Options.Description: Kubaz may begin the game with one rank in Stealth.

Options.Name: Survival
Options.Description: Kubaz may begin the game with one rank in Survival.

Options.Name: Enhanced Vision
Options.Description: When making Ranged combat or Perception checks, Kubaz may remove up to [SE][SE] due to concealment or environmental factors (but not defense).

Options.Name: Dense Musculature
Options.Description: Once per round as a maneuver, may suffer 3 strain to leap horizontally or vertically to any location within medium range.

Options.Name: Indomitable
Options.Description: A Lannik removes up to [SE][SE] caused by Critical Injuries, the disoriented condition, and fear from all checks he makes.

Options.Name: Brawl
Options.Description: Lasats may begin with a rank in Brawl.  They still may not raise the skill above rank 2 during character creation.

Options.Name: Lore
Options.Description: Lasats may begin with a rank in Lore. They still may not raise the skill above rank 2 during character creation.

Options.Name: Prehensile Feet
Options.Description: Lasats can move along a vertical surface as if the surface was horizontal.

Options.Name: Combat Skill
Options.Description: Mandalorian Humans start the game with one rank in a combat skill of their choice.

Options.Name: Knowledge Skills
Options.Description: Mandalorian Humans start the game with one rank in two knowledge skills of their choice.

Options.Name: Sightless Vision
Options.Description: Melittos can perceive their surroundings without needing light and never suffer penalties on combat or Perception checks due to darkness or other factors that affect vision.

Options.Name: Reliant on Toxins
Options.Description: Melittos require toxins of their native atmosphere to live. Offworld, they gain a free respirator that emulates this environment. They treat standard air as corrosive with a rating of 6.

Options.Name: Sensory Tendrils
Options.Description: Mikkians add [BO] to all Perception checks.

Options.Name: Amphibious
Options.Description: Mon Calamari can breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

SubSpeciesList.Name: Northern Mustafarian
SubSpeciesList.Description: Please see page 26 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

Options.Name: Arid/Hot Environments
Options.Description: Northern Mustafarians may remove [SETBACK][SETBACK] to resist arid or hot environmental conditions.

SubSpeciesList.Name: Southern Mustafarian
SubSpeciesList.Description: Please see page 26 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

Options.Name: Arid/Hot Environments
Options.Description: Southern Mustafarians may remove [SETBACK][SETBACK] to resist arid or hot environmental conditions.

Options.Name: Deep Pockets
Options.Description: Muun characters start the game with an additional 1,000 credits. They may not be spend during character creation.

Options.Name: Amphibious
Options.Description: Nautolans may breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

Options.Name: Negotiation
Options.Description: Neimoidians may begin the game with one free rank in Negotiation.

Options.Name: Deception
Options.Description: Neimoidians may begin the game with one free rank in Deception.

SubSpeciesList.Name: Kajain'sa'Nikto (Red Nikto)
SubSpeciesList.Description: The most common subspecies, the Kajain'sa'Nikto or "Red Nikto", adapted to survive in the Wannschok, or "Endless Wastes", a desert region on Kintan. They have a series of forehead ridges and small facial horns surrounding their eyes and on the chin.

Options.Name: Arid/Hot Environments
Options.Description: Red Niktos may remove [SETBACK] imposed due to arid or hot enviromental conditions.

SubSpeciesList.Name: Kadas'sa'Nikto (Green Nikto)
SubSpeciesList.Description: Kadas'sa'Nikto, or "Green Nikto," originated in the milder climatic regions of Kintan, such as the forests and the seacoasts. Their scaly faces have small facial horns surrounding the eyes and on the chin. Their main distinguishing features are the long climbing claws on their hands, which can also be used in combat.

Options.Name: May use claws when brawling
Options.Description: When a Green Nikto makes Brawl checks to deal damage to an opponent, he deals +1 damage and has a Critical Rating of 3.

Options.Name: Climbing
Options.Description: Green Nikto gain [BOOST] to Athletics checks made to climb trees and other surfaces their claws can pierce.

SubSpeciesList.Name: Esral'sa'Nikto (Mountain Nikto)
SubSpeciesList.Description: Esral'sa'Nikto, or "Mountain Nikto", adapted to the variable climate of the mountains of Kintan. They have large facial fins which are used for heat regulation. These fins also improve the Esral'sa'Nikto's hearing. Their skin is blue-gray, and they have neither horns nor breathing tubes.

SubSpeciesList.Name: Gluss'sa'Nikto (Pale Nikto)
SubSpeciesList.Description: Gluss'sa'Nikto, or "Pale Nikto", came from the Gluss'elta Islands of Kintan, causing them to be natural sailors. They have white-gray skin, eye-horns like the Kadas'sa'Nikto, and fins similar to those of the Esral'sa'Nikto, but smaller.

Options.Name: Swimmer
Options.Description: A Pale Nikto never suffers movement penalties for traveling through water and can hold his breath for a number of rounds equal to twice his Brawn rating before beginning to drown.

SubSpeciesList.Name: M'shento'su'Nikto (Southern Nikto)
SubSpeciesList.Description: M'shento'su'Nikto, or "Southern Nikto", have no horns, a covered nose, and several pairs of breathing tubes. These tubes are larger than those of the Kajain'sa'Nikto, and also act as primitive ultrasonic sensory organs. Their skin color varies from white to yellow or orange.

Options.Name: Sounds
Options.Description: Southern Nikto may add [BOOST] to Perception and Vigilance checks to detect sounds.

Options.Name: Cool
Options.Description: Pantorans may begin the game with one rank in Cool.

Options.Name: Negotiation
Options.Description: Pantorans may begin the game with one rank in Negotiation.

Options.Name: Tundra Dweller
Options.Description: When making skill checks, Pantorans may remove [SETBACK] imposed due to cold environmental conditions.

Options.Name: Coercion
Options.Description: Pau'ans may begin the game with one free rank in Coercion.

Options.Name: Negotiation
Options.Description: Pau'an may begin the game with one free rank in Negotiation.

Options.Name: Sensitive Hearing
Options.Description: Pau'an's add [BO] to all Perception and Vigilance checks while wearing ear protection. Without ear protection, they add [TH] to Perception and Vigilance checks instead.

Options.Name: Cool
Options.Description: Phydolons may begin the game with one rank in Cool.

Options.Name: Discipline
Options.Description: Phydolons may begin the game with one rank in Discipline.

Options.Name: Symbiotic Resilience
Options.Description: When recovering wounds naturally, Phydolons heal 1 extra wound per full night's rest. When critially injured, Phydolons may attempt to recover from one Critical Injury after a full night's rest, instead of a full week's.

Options.Name: Symbiont Isolation
Options.Description: When recovering from strain at the end of an encounter, Phydolons recover 1 less strain if no other Phydolons are present (to a minimum of 1).

Options.Name: No Vocal Chords
Options.Description: A vast majority of Polis Massans are born without vocal chords.

Options.Name: Posesses Vocal Chords
Options.Description: A small minority of Polis Massans do possess vocal chords. Referred to as "speakers" by their people, these rare individuals can physically speak languages, though their voices are soft and strangely resonant.

Options.Name: Telepathy
Options.Description: Polis Massans can communicate with other beings using a simple form of telepathy. At short range, this is akin to a broadcast, and any being will "hear" what the Polis Massan says. They can "whisper" to individuals at engaged range.

Options.Name: Amphibious
Options.Description: Can breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

Options.Name: Ink Spray
Options.Description: Can spray ink. Once per encounter, as an out-of-turn incidental, may suffer 2 strain to add [SE] to enemy check within short range. Add [SE][SE][SE] underwater.

Options.Name: Additional Limbs
Options.Description: Quermians have four arms and gain an additional free maneuver per turn. They still may not perform more than two maneuvers per turn, however.

Source.__text: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Options.Name: Perception
Options.Description: Sakiyans may begin the game with one rank in Perception.

Options.Name: Vigilance
Options.Description: Sakiyans may begin the game with one rank in Vigilance.

Options.Name: Glider
Options.Description: A Sathari can fall safely from any height and can glide over small gaps or distances while falling. While conscious, a Sathari character does not suffer damage from falling (see page 221 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook).

Options.Name: Sees in Darkness
Options.Description: Selonians see in almost total darkness. Remove all [SETBACK] added due to darkness.

Options.Name: May use tail when brawling
Options.Description: A Selonian's tail may be used as a brawl weapon. When used to attack, it uses the Brawl skill with the Agility characteristic. It always counts as equipped, and has the following profile: Damage +1, Critical 5, Range (Engaged), Disorient 2, Knockdown. They may activate Knockdown with [AD]

Options.Name: Hunter's Instincts
Options.Description: When making an Initiative check, a Shistavanens may use Survival instead of Vigilance or Cool.

Options.Name: Brawl
Options.Description: Shistavanens may begin the game with one rank in Brawl.

Options.Name: Survival
Options.Description: Shistavanens may begin the game with one rank in Survival.

Options.Name: Methane Breather
Options.Description: Skakoans start the game with a Skakoan Pressure Suit.

Options.Name: Methane Breather
Options.Description: Skakoans treat standard planetary air and pressure as a corrosive atmosphere with rating 6.

Options.Name: Rest
Options.Description: Thisspiasians only need two hours sleep to heal all strain.

Options.Name: Meditation
Options.Description: Once per session, Thisspiasians may spend ten minutes meditating to heal strain equal to twice their ranks in Discipline.

Options.Name: Cultural Adopters
Options.Description: Tholothians add an automatic [AD] when making social skill checks to interact with non-Tholothians.

Options.Name: Natural Roots
Options.Description: When making a check to heal strain in a natural or wild setting, Tholothians heal one additional strain.

Options.Name: Primitive Nerves
Options.Description: Add [SE][SE] to Coercion checks targeting Tognath characters.

Options.Name: Atmospheric Requirement
Options.Description: Tognaths must wear a specialized mask or breathing apparatus to breathe outside their native atmosphere. Tognath characters start the game with a breath mask and treat oxygen as a corrosive atmosphere with rating 5. However, they can surivive in vacuum for up to five minutes before suffering its effects.

Options.Name: Egg Mates
Options.Description: If Tognath characters have an egg-mate, they may spend a Destiny Point as an incidental to learn the general location or direction of that egg mate, as long as the egg mate is within extreme rage of their location. They also learn the current emotional state of the egg mate as well.

Options.Name: Pack Instincts
Options.Description: When performing the assist maneuver, Togrutas grant [BOOST][BOOST] instead of [BOOST].

Options.Name: Silhouette
Options.Description: Toydarians are smaller than average and count as silhouette 0.

Options.Name: Hoverer
Options.Description: Toydarians have wings that allow them to hover slightly off the ground. When hovering, Toydarians do not have to spend additional maneuvers when navigating difficult terrain. Otherwise, their wings allow them no extra capabilities beyond those of a normal, walking character.

Source.__text: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Options.Name: Wound Regeneration
Options.Description: Whenever a trandoshan would recover one or more wounds from natural rest or recuperation in a Bacta tank, he recovers one additional wound. Trandoshans can regrow lost limbs as well, though it usully takes at least a month before the limb is usable.

Options.Name: May use claws when brawling
Options.Description: When a Trandoshan makes Brawl checks to deal damage to an opponent, he deals +1 damage and has a Critical Rating of 3.

Options.Name: Bantha Riders
Options.Description: When making Athletics or Survival checks to handle a bantha, Tusken Raiders add automatic [SU] to the check.

Options.Name: Water Reclamator
Options.Description: Tusken Raiders reduce the difficulty of all Resilience and Survival checks related to enduring extreme heat or going without water once.

Options.Name: Charm
Options.Description: Twi'leks may begin the game with one rank in Charm.

Options.Name: Deception
Options.Description: Twi'leks may begin the game with one rank in Deception.

Options.Name: Arid/Hot Environments
Options.Description: When making skill checks, Twi'leks may remove [SETBACK] imposed due to arid or hot environmental conditions.

Source.__text: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Options.Name: Entrancing Gaze
Options.Description: Umbarans add [BO] to all Charm, Deception, and Negotiation checks.

Options.Name: Shadow Dweller
Options.Description: When making skill checks, Umbarans remove up to [SE][SE] due to darkness, and add [SE] to checks made in bright natural light.

Options.Name: Microvision
Options.Description: When closely examining an object, Verpine add [BO] to their Perception checks.

Options.Name: Radio-wave Communication
Options.Description: Verpine can produce and hear radio waves, which allows them to silently communicate with other Verpine and specially-tuned comlinks within a 100-kilometer range.

Options.Name: Amphibious
Options.Description: Vurk can breathe and move underwater without penalty.

Options.Name: Cold Blooded
Options.Description: Vurk take an additional [SE] in cold environments.

Options.Name: One Rank in Resilience
Options.Description: Weequay may begin the game with one rank in Resilience.

Options.Name: One Rank in Athletics
Options.Description: Weequay may begin the game with one rank in Athletics.

Options.Name: Communicative Pheromones
Options.Description: Weequay can communicate non-verbally with other Weequays up to Short Range.

Options.Name: Tusks
Options.Description: When a Whiphid makes a Brawl check to deal damage to an opponent, their attack deals +2 point of damage, has a Crit Rating of 4, and has the Vicious 1 quality.

Options.Name: Hardy Survivalist
Options.Description: A Whiphid adds automatic [SU] to Survival checks and can survive for several weeks without food thanks to reserve blubber.

Source.__text: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Options.Name: Rages when Wounded
Options.Description: When a Wookiee has suffered any wounds, he deals +1 damage to Brawl and Melee attacks. When a Wookiee is Critically Injured, he instead deals +2 damage to Brawl and Melee attacks.

Options.Name: Additional Limbs
Options.Description: Xexto have four arms and gain an additional free maneuver per turn. They still may not perform more than two maneuvers per turn, however.

Options.Name: Fearsome Countenance
Options.Description: A Zabrak adds automatic [ADVANTAGE] to all Coercion checks he makes.
